subject: Re: [junit] Looking for a sample java project for using JUnit
msgSnippet: Sreedhar, Cool!  I ve found that the best way to learn is to write something myself.  I think of something that I ve been interested in doing lately, and write
messageBody:
Sreedhar,

Cool! I've found that the best way to learn is to write something
myself. I think of something that I've been interested in doing lately,
and write some code in that direction, such as a digital jukebox, a
custom news aggregator, or a screensaver. I'm not intending to finish
the job, but it helps me write code that I understand, since JUnit is
the thing I'm trying to learn. If I try to learn using someone else's
code, then I'm never sure if problems are coming from JUnit or the other
code.

Not only that, but once you have a little experience with JUnit, google
for "test-driven development". That's fun stuff. Good luck,

David Saff

Sridhar wrote:

> Hi,
>
> I started learning JUnit.Now I would like to use JUnit to test a
> simple project(having minimum number of classes).
>
> Would anybody suggest me the availability of that sample project
> (code).
>
> Iam using JUnit plugged into Eclipse.
>
> Thanks
> Sreedhar K
